info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 6:46PM MDT until July 07 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN GOLDEN VALLEY, SOUTHEASTERN WHEATLAND AND NORTHEASTERN SWEET GRASS COUNTIES... At 646 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain over the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. While precipitation has ended, it will take some time for the water to work into area streams and move downstream as well as subside in areas of poor drainage. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Golden Valley, Southeastern Wheatland and Northeastern Sweet Grass Counties This includes the following streams and drainages... Simmons Creek, Mud Creek, Fish Creek, Rock Creek, Cherry Creek, Big Coulee Creek and Spring Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Remain alert for flooding of creeks, streams, and normally dry coulees even in areas not receiving rainfall downstream. These can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes even from distant rainfall upstream. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
